content: Clicking on the message timestamp jumps to a /near/ view for that message. We should indicate this in the timestamp tooltip. Thoughts on how to describe it? I'll kick it off with a poll, but free-form discussion is also very helpful. Please add more poll options as well.

/poll What phrase should we add to the timestamp tooltip?
Click to go to conversation
Click to see this message in context

Hmm, perhaps it should be a different message when you're already looking at the conversation. A message like "go to conversation" makes good sense when you're in some interleaved view and going to the conversation is the main effect of clicking through there, but not so much when the conversation is where you already are.
Mm, yeah. Why might you want to click on it if you are already in the conversation? As an alternative way of getting the /near link?
If we're introducing the z/zoom terminology being discussed in #design > navigate to search result , I guess something like "Zoom to message (z)" is an option.

Alya Abbott said:

Mm, yeah. Why might you want to click on it if you are already in the conversation? As an alternative way of getting the /near link?

Yeah, also Right Click + "Copy link" works with it, so one might use it without actually clicking the link.
